subject: Nutrition
title: Scurvy in the Modern World
description: A 60-second lesson on Scurvy in the Modern World.

hook.text: Scurvy sounds ancient, but doctors still diagnose it todayâ€”even in wealthy countries.

buildup.text: People who eat almost no fruits or vegetables for weeks can develop scurvy in the 21st century.

discovery.text: College students on ramen, elderly on tea and toast, and picky eaters are at highest risk.

twist.text: A 2009 study found that 7% of Americans had vitamin C levels low enough to be considered deficient.

climax.text: The cure hasn't changed in 250 years: eat a piece of fruit. Prevention is that simple.

punchline.text: An 18th-century disease still hides in modern diets.

quiz.question: What percentage of Americans have dangerously low vitamin C?
